A Photometer is based on photoelectric effect, where electrons get emitted when light falls onto certain materials (like metals). A typical PMT consists of several components: 
1) Photocathode - emits electron-hole pairs upon interaction with incident radiation; it can have different types like bialkali or multi-anode type depending application needs  
2)Phosphorescence screen – converts electrical charge into visible flashlight image for human eye visibility    
3)Crystal dynodes which multiply number/charge generated from primary event via secondary emission process   
4)Anode that collects all charges together as one pulse signal after amplification through dyelines     
The efficiency depends not only energy but also intensity & wavelength so if we know this information about incoming photon(s), then yes they could potentially differentiate them using above mentioned properties
